entry.title: Asian Economies Could Benefit From Reduced Dollar Influence, Says Devere CEO
entry.summary:
The CEO of asset management firm Devere Group says the world is shifting â€œaway from a dollar-dominated financial system.â€ Emphasizing that a shift away from U.S. dollar influence â€œcould have positive implications for Asian economies,â€ he described: â€œWith the dollar losing its stranglehold, Asian economies would also likely experience a diversification of reserve currencies, paving the way for greater regional trade and investment opportunities.â€
How Reducing Dollar Dependence Could Benefit Asian Countries
Nigel Green, CEO of asset management firm Devere Group, published an opinion piece in Asia Times on Friday arguing that the decline of the U.S. dollar could benefit Asian economies. The executive began:
I believe that we are witnessing in real time the world beginning to shift awayâ€¦

entry.title: SEC Settles With Crypto Firm Quantstamp Over Securities Laws Violations
entry.summary:
In a recent development, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has settled with crypto firm Quantstamp following charges of violating securities law which the SEC leveled against it. Quantstamp agreed to settle with the SEC without admitting or denying the charges.
Part of the statement read:
Quantstamp agreed to a cease-and-desist order and to pay disgorgement of $1,979,201, prejudgment interest of $494,314, and a civil penalty of $1 million.
How Quantstamp Violated Securities Laws
Quanstamp raised over $28 million following its Initial Coin Offering (ICO) in October-November 2017 when it sold its native token QSP to close to 5,000 investors (including ones residing in the US).
The SEC alleged that these QSP tokens were a security when applied to the Howeâ€¦

Worldcoin Vulnerability: Blockchain Security Firm Exposes Unverified Orb Operator Access
entry.summary:
Blockchain security company CertiK recently revealed a serious flaw that put the Worldcoin system at serious risk. The systemâ€™s security and integrity might have been compromised if the vulnerability allowed Orb operators unrestricted access.
Usersâ€™ iris information was collected as part of Worldcoinâ€™s Orb activities, necessitating a strong verification process to guarantee that only reputable businesses are in charge of the operations.
The systemâ€™s fault, however, made it possible for bad actorsÂ to get through the rigorous verification process without fulfilling the requirements.
Following the usual whitehat disclosure process, CertiK quickly informed the Worldcoin security team of the vulnerability.
Prompt Patching: Addressing The Vulnerability
Worldcoin has provided a patch â€¦

entry.title: Class Action Lawsuit Against Tether, Bitfinex Dismissed
entry.summary:
A class action lawsuit filed against cryptocurrency firms Tether and Bitfinex was dismissed Friday by a federal judge in New York. The judge ruled the complaint lacked plausible claims of injury and failed to show that Tetherâ€™s stablecoin USDT had diminished in value.
Judge Dismisses Market Manipulation Case Against Bitfinex and Tether
A high-profile class action lawsuit filed against cryptocurrency firms Tether and Bitfinex was dismissed Friday by chief judge Laura Taylor Swain of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York. Judge Swain ruled the complaint lacked plausible allegations of injury and failed to demonstrate damages resulting from the actions of Tether and Bitfinex.
It's a good Friday.#Tether and @Bitfinex Win Comprehensive Legal Victory as U.S. Distrâ€¦

entry.summary:
The success of alpha cryptoÂ Bitcoin in the second quarter of 2023 was crucial for Block Inc. The payments startup, led by Twitter founder Jack Dorsey, reported outstanding earnings, recording $5.5 billion in revenue overall. Notably, a sizeable portion of the $2.4 billion came from Bitcoin sales.
Comparing this time to last yearâ€™s figure, the revenue associated with Bitcoin has increased by an astounding 34%. Despite experiencing lower Bitcoin prices throughout the quarter, the gain in Bitcoin revenue and gross profit was primarily driven by an increase in the amount of BTC sold to clients.
Cash App, Blockâ€™s consumer-facing product, has become crucial in sustaining the businessâ€™s outstanding revenue growth in recent years. This program not only sped up financial transactions but alsoâ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers:Â SHIB Surges to 3-Month High to Start the Weekend
entry.summary:
Shiba inu was a notable gainer during Saturdayâ€™s session, as the meme coin climbed to a three-month high. The move comes as traders continue to react to Binanceâ€™s decision to approve the coin as a collateral asset, in addition to the upcoming launch of Shibarium. Dogecoin also snapped its recent losing streak today.
Shiba Inu (SHIB)
Shiba inu (SHIB) jumped to a three-month high on Saturday, with prices surging by as much as 10%.
Following a low of $0.000008551 on Friday, SHIB/USD surged to a peak of $0.000009509 earlier in todayâ€™s session.
This resulted in the meme coin climbing to its strongest point since May 6, when price reached a high of $0.00001007.
Looking at the chart, the move comes as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) moved past a resistance level of 67.00.
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 73.62, which is its highest level since February.
Should momentum continue throughout the weekend, the next target for bulls is likely to be a ceiling at $0.00001025.
Dogecoin (DOGE)
In addition to SHIB, dogecoin (DOGE) also rose higher today, snapping a three-day losing streak in the process.
DOGE/USD rallied to a high at $0.07628, less than 24 hours after the meme coin was at a low of $0.07279.
As a result of this surge in price, DOGE is now trading at its highest point since Wednesday, after breaking out of a resistance zone of $0.0760.
This coincided with the RSI moving past its own ceiling at the 52.00 mark. It is currently at a reading of 55.84.
Despite todayâ€™s rally, dogecoin is still trading nearly 3% lower than at the same point last weekend.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Can meme coins continue to rally this weekend? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC, ETH Extend Declines on Saturday, as Markets React to Latest NFP Report
entry.summary:
Bitcoin started the weekend trading below the $29,000 level, as markets continued to react to the latest U.S. nonfarm payrolls (NFP) report. 187,000 jobs were added to the economy in July, less than the 200,000 markets had expected. Ethereum neared a multi-week low.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) dropped to below the $29,000 level on Saturday, as traders continued to digest the latest nonfarm payrolls report.
Following a high of $29,302.08 on Friday, BTC/USD slipped to a bottom of $28,885.34 earlier in todayâ€™s session.
This was the first time since Tuesday that the worldâ€™s largest cryptocurrency had fallen below $29,000.
Saturdayâ€™s decline came as the relative strength index (RSI) moved to a long-term support level at 42.00.
The index is currently tracking marginally below this point, as bears attempt to maintain the current downward momentum.
However, price has since consolidated, and as of writing is trading above todayâ€™s low, with a current price of $29,022.59.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) remained above the $1,800 level, despite bearish sentiment intensifying on Saturday.
ETH/USD dropped to a bottom at $1,817.41 earlier in todayâ€™s session, following a peak of $1,847.91 the day prior.
The decline saw ethereum drop close to Tuesdayâ€™s low at $1,812, which was the weakest point the cryptocurrency had hit since June 21.
This latest downturn comes as price strength moved below a key support point at the 43.00 mark.
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 41.57.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect this weekendâ€™s sentiment to remain bearish? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin TvrdiÄ‡, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.
